title: SQL Injection (Basic)
mitigation: Use parameterized queries and prepared statements

title: SQL Injection (Intermediate)
mitigation: Input validation, parameterized queries, and least privilege database access

title: SQL Injection (Advanced)
mitigation: Comprehensive input validation, WAF implementation, and database activity monitoring

title: Blind SQL Injection (Boolean)
mitigation: Consistent response handling and parameterized queries

title: Blind SQL Injection (Time Based)
mitigation: Query timeout controls and input validation

mitigation: Output encoding and Content Security Policy implementation

mitigation: Input sanitization and output encoding

mitigation: Secure DOM manipulation and client-side input validation

title: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
mitigation: CSRF tokens and SameSite cookie attributes

title: Session Management Flaws
mitigation: Configure session cookies with secure: true, httpOnly: true, sameSite: 'strict', and proper session timeout

title: Session Fixation
mitigation: Regenerate session ID after successful authentication

title: Insecure Direct Object Reference
mitigation: Access control validation and indirect object references

title: Missing Function Level Access Control
mitigation: Role-based access control on all application functions

title: Privilege Escalation
mitigation: Server-side privilege validation and principle of least privilege

title: Weak Authentication
mitigation: Multi-factor authentication and strong password policies

title: Poor Data Validation
mitigation: Comprehensive input validation and sanitization

title: Insecure Cryptographic Storage
mitigation: Strong encryption algorithms and proper key management

title: Insecure Communication
mitigation: Enforce HTTPS with HSTS and proper TLS configuration

title: Failure to Restrict URL Access
mitigation: URL-based access control and authentication checks

title: Unvalidated Redirects and Forwards
mitigation: Whitelist allowed redirect destinations

title: Cross-Site Script Inclusion (XSSI)
mitigation: JSONP validation and Content-Type headers

title: Client Side Injection
mitigation: Client-side input validation and secure coding practices

title: Poor Session Management
mitigation: Secure session configuration and proper session lifecycle management

title: NoSQL Injection
mitigation: Input validation and parameterized NoSQL queries

title: LDAP Injection
mitigation: LDAP query parameterization and input validation

mitigation: Disable external entity processing in XML parsers

mitigation: XML input validation and safe parsing

title: Broken Cryptography Challenge
mitigation: Use industry-standard cryptographic libraries and algorithms

title: Weak Encryption
mitigation: Strong encryption algorithms with appropriate key lengths

title: Hash Length Extension Attack
mitigation: Use HMAC instead of plain hash functions for integrity

title: Insecure Randomness
mitigation: Use cryptographically secure random number generators

title: Security through Obscurity
mitigation: Implement proper security controls instead of relying on obscurity

title: Reverse Engineering Challenge
mitigation: Code obfuscation and runtime application self-protection

title: Binary Exploitation
mitigation: Memory safety techniques and bounds checking

mitigation: API input validation and parameterized queries

mitigation: Mobile app obfuscation and anti-tampering measures

mitigation: Certificate pinning and encrypted communications
